content: stitch every stitch will be a knit stitch whether you are on the rs or the ws this makes it a great beginner s project and also an easy piece for tv knitting or knitting by the fire a few ccoomm//ppaaggeess//hhooww--ttoo--kknniitt--iicceellaannddiicc--bbiinndd--ooffff-- vviiddeeoo--ttuuttoorriiaall the pattern note that you will need to switch colors between each stripe after you complete the final row of one stripe ws break the yarn and attach the new color to begin the next stripe rs you will notice that the color sequence repeats itself after 13 stripes and then repeats the beginning of the color sequence for 6 more stripes before ending with an extra stripe of honeycrisp because i couldn t resist adding another pop of red at the end while the colors may run through the same 13-stripe order the sizes of the stripes will vary to give a little extra visual interest stripe 1 holding the yarn double and with c1 stripe 5 with c5 plinth knit 8 row canopy co 160 sts using the long tail stripe 6 with c2 anchor knit 8 row cast on knit one row ws knit another row stripe 7 with c6 cerise knit 24 row rs knit 13 more row ending with a ws stripe 8 with c4 cosmos knit 16 row row you have completed 15 row in addition stripe 9 with c2 anchor knit 16 row to the co stripe 10 with c7 honeycrisp knit 8 row stripe 2 with c2 anchor knit 8 row stripe 11 with c2 anchor knit 16 row stripe 3 with c3 blueprint knit 16 row stripe 12 with c8 medallion knit 8 row stripe 4 with c4 cosmos knit 16 row campfire blanket v 1 1 05/23 © seth richardson 2020-2023 page 4 the pattern continued
